result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Clarence B Hamilton in court with attorney Robert J. Baratki.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer. TRANSCRIPT FILED 12-03-2015/tk
Atty Baratki indicates that he was told the notice that went out in October was in error and the he did remedy the issue.

BTC: It is this Court's obligation to report this to OLR and they will get a copy of this transcript. This defendant's plea is not a valid plea because at the time, his counsel was practicing without a license.
         The Court will impose a $500.00 penalty and the Court further orders that Mr. Baratki will not be allowed to charge SPD office to reappear in this Court to remedy this situation with regards to change of plea.
         The State will submit an order. Mr. Baratki has 30 days to pay this penalty. Mr. Baratki is to file with all judiciary in this county and the DCA his recertification prior to practicing in any court.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Clarence B Hamilton in court with attorney Robert J. Baratki.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Upon plea to 13CF1484, the State will DRI 14CF1578. The State agrees to follow PSI, defense is free to argue.

Defendant Clarence B Hamilton in court with attorney Robert J. Baratki.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense is asking for adjourned COP to allow defendant to finish the treatment program he is enrolled in. Deft has been in since 9/4 and it's a 45 day program. The State indicates that regardless of any treatment the offer will remain and the State was anticipating going forward with COP.

BTC: Defense adj is granted. Set COP out for 60 days  Plea hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant called the Courts indicating he was in treatment in Madison. He intends to be at his change of plea hearing on 9/29 but he has not been able to reach his attorney. Defendant is no longer in custody in Danie County Jail.
for defendant from Dane County Jail for plea hearing 09-29-15 at 9:00 AM

BTC: Vacate warrant/reinstate bond  Plea hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 09:00 am.
